intro: Sclarea acuta, commonly known as the sharp-edged angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and flower clusters. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, shaded woodland areas. The plant features tall, hollow stems and compound leaves with serrated edges, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces a strong, spicy scent. Sclarea acuta is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
